response:
A young woman with multifocal CNS lesions affecting optic nerve, brainstem, cerebellar pathways and long tracts, with relative preservation of cognition, strongly suggests relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis. However alternative inflammatory demyelinating, autoimmune, granulomatous and structural causes of multifocal brainstem and optic involvement must be excluded.

differential_diagnosis = ["Relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis", "Neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder (aquaporin-4 IgG associated)", "Myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein (MOG) antibody-associated disease", "Primary CNS vasculitis or systemic autoimmune disease with CNS involvement (e.g. systemic lupus erythematosus, Sj\u00f6gren syndrome, Beh\u00e7et disease)", "Neurosarcoidosis", "Brainstem or cervicomedullary tumour (e.g. glioma, meningioma) with coexisting optic neuropathy", "Vitamin B12 deficiency with subacute combined degeneration of the cord"]
